definition[0]: a feeling of friendship resulting from shared interests or experiences
example[0]: Regular outings contribute to a sense of fellowship among co-workers.
definition[1]: a group of people who share an interest or belief, especially Christians who have religious ceremonies together
definition[2]: a job at a university which involves making a detailed study of a particular subject
definition[3]: money given to a student to allow them to continue their studies at an advanced level
example[1]: Florian came to the United States on a Fulbright fellowship.
definition[4]: a group of officials who decide which students will receive this money
example[2]: He received a gold medal from the Artistsâ€™ Fellowship in New York.
